availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Susan Murray Stone (Daviess County, KY, domestic lady )

body.p: Daviess County, Kentucky, domestic lady. Kentucky native. Daughter of Robert W. Murray and S. A. Murray. Married to William S. Stone. Resident of Daviess County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seventeen enslaved persons in Daviess County in 1850. Domestic lady in Daviess County in 1860. Household owned eighteen enslaved persons in Daviess County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 1, p. 360A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2, p. 850.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2, p. 387B.
"Susan Murray Stone (1827-1879)," Find A Grave, Memorial #138177163, accessed August 25, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/138177163.
